stream_context.summary: Kaze worked on UV mapping and designing a volcano section of the overworld. The stream was heavily dominated by technical troubleshooting, starting with installing a Blender add-on, then battling severe performance issues with Blender 4.1, which led him to adopt a new, faster, but buggier N64-specific renderer. He also imported a Luigi model, sparking discussion about a potential co-op mode.

development_findings.summary: The final overworld is planned to be a single, large, seamless level that dynamically loads content as the player moves through it, a significant technical undertaking for the N64.
development_findings.quote: After your pass is done, I'm going to make this all into one big level that loads dynamically as you walk through it.

development_findings.summary: Kaze encountered severe, show-stopping performance issues with Blender 4.1, which made 3D modeling work nearly impossible and forced him to seek an alternative rendering solution during the stream.
development_findings.quote: It wasn't like this last stream. Why did they do this to Blender, man? Dude, it's actually unreasonable to work with this.

development_findings.summary: To solve Blender's performance problems, Kaze reluctantly installed the F64 renderer developed by the community (Lilaa). It dramatically improved viewport speed, though it introduced its own visual inaccuracies.
development_findings.quote: Wait, maybe we have to take back the death threats. Wait, maybe Lilaa was right.

development_findings.summary: Kaze debugged an issue where Mario's hair disappeared upon export, tracing it to a 'write all' setting in an obscure JSON configuration file that was automatically re-enabling itself, causing conflicts.
development_findings.quote: It turns itself on! The option that breaks if you don't have bleed activated turns itself on whenever you open the file.

development_findings.summary: Course 7 is complete enough for beta testing and has been confirmed to run correctly on original N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: I finished most of course 7 and I set it out for a beta test... It fully works on real N64, which is amazing.

development_findings.summary: A Luigi model was imported into the project. While co-op is the desired feature, his final role is undecided. An alternative idea is to make him an unlockable character, referencing old fan theories.
development_findings.quote: So Co-op confirmed? Well, I'm not 100% sure exactly how Luigi ties into this yet. Co-op would be the coolest option.

development_findings.summary: A new quality-of-life feature has been implemented: after collecting a star, a dialog box appears asking the player if they want to exit the level or remain in it.
development_findings.quote: Do you want to return to the overworld? Stay or leave? If you hit stay, you stay. If you hit leave, it pops you out. Isn't that cool?

development_findings.summary: A concept for a side level was discussed: infiltrating an oil tanker to fight a boss, which then unlocks a new level called 'Oily Body Bay'. Kaze liked the idea of a mission being required to unlock a side level.
The final ROM size is projected to be exactly 64 megabytes. The current size is approximately 59.95 MB.
A PAL version of the game is not a current priority and will be considered only after the main NTSC version is further along.
development_findings.quote: For me Pala right now is in the background. That will have to be an afterthought.

context_findings.summary: Kaze believes successful politics streamers cannot be intellectually honest, as changing one's mind (a sign of intelligence) is penalized by audience loss, forcing them to be either grifters or unintelligent.
context_findings.quote: If you're a politics streamer and you ever change your mind on anything, you're going to lose a portion of your audience. So to be a successful politics streamer you have to be completely dead set on all your beliefs... So it kind of necessitates that as a politics streamer you're either grifting or stupid.

context_findings.summary: Kaze questions modern economic structures, wondering why massive increases in productivity due to technology haven't resulted in significantly less work required for survival, speculating it's due to consumption of 'needless bullshit'.
context_findings.quote: The human race now, with all the automation, is probably literally like a thousand times more productive... So how come we don't have like literally 5 minutes of work a day? Doesn't make sense, right?

context_findings.summary: Kaze expresses a general disinterest and skepticism towards philosophy, finding the concepts he has encountered to be either painfully obvious or, in the case of Kant, delusional and wrong.
context_findings.quote: Anytime I read theory like that, I'm just like, yeah, this is the most fucking obvious shit ever. Why do you write a book? This is just obvious, bro.

context_findings.summary: Kaze holds a contrarian view on targeted advertising, preferring relevant ads over random ones and questioning the mentality of those who fear being manipulated by them.
context_findings.quote: I prefer customized ads. If I'm going to have to sit there and watch a fucking ad, at least show me a product I might want to buy.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is considering getting a sponsor for a future event (F3) to cover costs like paying his editor, but is aware of potential community backlash against sponsorships.
context_findings.quote: How much would you guys hate the idea of F3 this year having a YouTube sponsor? Because that's like the easiest way I can justify making another F3. If I get paid for it.

context_findings.summary: Kaze recently upgraded to Windows 11, not by choice, but out of fear he had a computer virus. He finds the new OS buggy, with frequent hangs and blue screens.

biobak.summary: Kaze estimates that creating a side level will take him one or two days, while it would take Biobak (the artist) a week, indicating a potential difference in workload or process for these smaller levels.
biobak.quote: Day or two for you and a week for me.

biobak.summary: Kaze suggests Biobak should also use the new F64 Blender renderer, implying it could benefit the art pipeline despite its bugs.
biobak.quote: Damn, Biobak, maybe you should download this renderer too.

zeina.summary: Kaze makes a brief, joking comment about his relationship with Zeina after she appears in chat, reflecting their casual dynamic.
zeina.quote: What's your life without keys? Probably basically the same. We don't really need each other that much.

key_stories.title: The Blender Performance Nightmare
key_stories.summary: Frustrated by crippling performance issues in the latest Blender version, Kaze was convinced by his community to install a custom N64-specific renderer. The new tool solved the performance problem but introduced its own set of visual inaccuracies, trading one problem for another in the name of productivity.
key_stories.challenge: The new version of Blender (4.1) was performing so poorly that it was nearly impossible for Kaze to do any 3D modeling work, with simple operations causing the program to lag severely.
key_stories.process: Kaze first expressed extreme frustration with Blender's lag. Following suggestions from his chat (specifically Lilaa), he reluctantly downloaded and installed a custom, N64-focused renderer for Blender called F64. After a quick test, he was impressed by the speed increase and adopted it for the rest of the stream.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze installed the F64 renderer, which dramatically improved viewport performance, allowing him to continue working. However, he then had to contend with the new renderer's own set of bugs, such as inaccurate decal emulation.
key_stories.key_quote: Dude, it's actually unreasonable to work with this. What the fuck? I might have to go back to an old Blender version just because of this.

key_stories.title: The Case of the Missing Hair
key_stories.summary: A persistent bug where Mario's hair would disappear was traced to an obscure project-wide setting in a JSON file that automatically enabled a problematic export option. Kaze had to dig into the configuration files to find and disable the setting, highlighting the hidden complexities of the development toolchain.
key_stories.challenge: After exporting Mario's model, Kaze discovered his hair was missing, a recurring and frustrating bug.
key_stories.process: Initially, Kaze was unsure if the bug was caused by a new code change or his own export settings. He investigated the 'write all' option, which he knew caused issues. He then discovered that this setting was being automatically enabled by a project-wide configuration file every time he opened Blender, overriding his local choice. He had to manually edit the JSON file to stop this behavior.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze successfully identified the root cause in the repo's JSON configuration file and disabled the auto-setting. Reloading the file confirmed the fix, and Mario's hair was restored in subsequent exports.
key_stories.key_quote: It turns itself on! The option that breaks if you don't have bleed activated turns itself on whenever you open the... I don't want bleed and write all on over the entire repo.

key_stories.title: Luigi's Role
key_stories.summary: With Luigi's model now in the game, the team is weighing its options. The most ambitious goal is a full co-op mode, but Kaze is also considering a simpler character-swap unlockable as a fallback, demonstrating a pragmatic approach to an exciting but challenging feature.
key_stories.challenge: The team needs to decide how to incorporate Luigi into the game after his model was created and imported.
key_stories.process: Kaze imported the Luigi model during the stream, prompting discussion about his role. He acknowledged that co-op would be the 'coolest' and most ambitious implementation. He also floated a secondary, less technically demanding idea of making Luigi a secret unlock, showing a willingness to have a backup plan.
key_stories.outcome: The implementation is still undecided. Co-op is the ideal goal, but if it proves too difficult, the backup plan is to make Luigi an unlockable single-player character, playing on old fan theories about Mario 64.
key_stories.key_quote: So Co-op confirmed? Well, I'm not 100% sure exactly how Luigi ties into this yet. Co-op would be the coolest option.
